metadata.title: CVE-2017-5097 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Skia in Google Chrome priorto 60.0.3112.78 for Linux allowed a remote attacker to perform an out ofbounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-browser-l10n - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-chromedriver - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '60.0.3112.78-0ubuntu0.16.04.1293').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'Ubuntu touch end-of-life').
